task.title: Displaying a background image for a video game in <canvas>
task.shortdesc: This document instructs on how to load and render an image for use as a background in a video game.

context.p: To accomplish this goal you will need to:

ul.li: Have a <canvas> element declared and called in the HTML page
Create a JavaScript file that the HTML page calls
Provide an image for the JavaScript to load
Write a function to render the image

substep.cmd: Write variables for a new image and a true / false state for when the image is ready: var bgReady = false; var bgImage = new Image();
Write an onload function that sets the true / false state to true: bgImage.onload = function (){bgReady = true;};
Set a source for the Image() method: bgImage.src = "Background.png";

step.cmd: Create and call the rendering function.

substep.cmd: Declare the function: var render = function(){
Refer to the <canvas> drawing context in a drawImage method: ctx.drawImage(bgImage, 0, 0);}

step.cmd: Call the rendering function within the update loop: render();
